item.description:
Why switch from eMacs to Nvim?

In all honesty you need some backstory here first. For the last 6 years I have used emacs, namely doom eMacs for all of my note taking and development work. I mainly use eMacs though for org mode & org-roam for my note taking and knowledge base system.

eMacs is great and has served me well, however I have had some issues with it, namely org-roam has had this recently habit of rebuilding and re-indexing it’s database everytime I launch it; as I have a lot of notes this process can take a long time, upto a minute, which might not sound like much in the grand scheme of things but when you just want to get to work or get something out of your head it can start to grate. Note: This isn’t due to poor hardware on my side, I have a beefy laptop with 64gb of ram that can handle multiple VM’s running whilst driving different screens etc.
